condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements with Project States | Description :The Recipient, through MHRD, shall cause eachProject State and its respective SIS to execute a Letter of Undertaking in form and substance satisfactory to the Association |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements | Description :The Recipient shall cause MHRD, through EBBII, to oversee and beresponsible for the day-today implementation of the Program | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Land | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that no Credit proceeds will be utilized for any land or otherland associated asset acquisition nor involuntary resettlement | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Manuals and Plans | Description :The Recipient shall apply the SSA Framework for Implementation and the Manualon Financial Management and Procurement | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Procurement | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that all goods, works and services for the Project areprocured in accordance with the Manual on Financial Management and Procurement | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguards | Description :The Recipient shall carry out and shall cause the Project Executing Agencies to carryout the Project in accordance with the Environmental Assessment Report | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: System of state level achievement surveys (SLAS) established
Specific early grades quality programmes implemented to strengthen foundation in language and numeracy
Development and use of school performance standards
Increased enrolment share of ST children vis-a-vis relevant age group share in population at primary and upper primary levels
Increase in the student attendance rate
Increased enrolment share of Muslim children vis-a-vis relevant age group share in population at primary and upper primary levels
Increased enrolment share of SC children vis-a-vis relevant age group share in population at primary and upper primary levels
Improved utilization of funds by states
Increased enrolment share of OBC Children vis-a-vis relevant age group share in population at primary and upper primary levels
Increased enrolment share of girls, vis-a-vis relevant age group share in population at primary and upper primary levels
More government school teachers trained through improved in-service training
CRC and BRC academic support and supervision
Increase in the number of children enrolled at upper primary level in schools
Increase in separate toilets for girls in government schools
Increased enrolment percentage out of identified CWSN at primary and upper primary level
Increase in the retention rate at primary level
Increase in the transition rate from primary to upper primary
System for learning assessment at the primary level
